description_txt: stated on July 16, 2014 in a meme on social media:
quote_txt: Former President George W. Bush and former Vice President Dick Cheney are "unable to visit Europe due to outstanding warrants."

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2014 in a "Meet the Press" pundit panel:
quote_txt: "We are accepting more legal immigrants than we ever have in the history (of the United States.)"

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2014 in an episode of his radio show:
quote_txt: Republicans "went out of the way to praise (Eric) Holder's nomination. ... Not a single Republican senator opposed Eric Holder's nomination."

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2014 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "In New York, your chances of getting murdered are 1 in 25,000. In Honduras, it’s 1 in 14."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2014 in a fund-raising email:
quote_txt: Says attorney general candidate Jon Richards "went so far to say he would only enforce the laws with which he personally agreed."

description_txt: stated on July 25, 2014 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: "Providence graduation rates are up."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2014 in an ad:
quote_txt: "Perdue mismanaged Pillowtex, and nearly 8,000 people got laid off."

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2014 in comments on MSNBC's "Ed Show":
quote_txt: "Teenage births cost Texas taxpayers $1.1 billion in health care, foster care and lost tax revenue in 2010 alone."

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2014 in an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: "We spend $18 billion a year on making sure that the federal government has immigrant enforcement agents. That's more than DEA and the ATF and the FBI and all the other enforcement (agencies) combined."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2014 in a segment on 'Lou Dobbs Tonight':
quote_txt: The Obama administration "manipulated deportation data to make it appear that the Border Patrol was deporting more illegal immigrants than the Bush administration."

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2014 in an ad:
quote_txt: U.S. Senate candidate Jack Kingston "spent our tax dollars on thousands of wasteful earmarks."

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2014 in a roundtable discussion on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: "74 percent of Republicans support the Affordable Care Act."

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2014 in a broadcast of "The Last Word with Lawrence O'Donnell":
quote_txt: "Radio Marti and TV Marti have spent more than $500 million to reach less than 1 percent of the Cuban population."

description_txt: stated on June 23, 2014 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Says 70 percent of Virginia’s Medicaid cost is for seniors in nursing homes.

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2014 in posts on Facebook:
quote_txt: Fox News is "banned in Canada" because it violates a law that "prevents ‘news’ channels from lying to their viewers."

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2014 in an interview on Fox news:
quote_txt: Says "nothing" in Obama’s $3.7 billion request to address the child immigrant situation "actually secures the border."

description_txt: stated on July 7, 2014 in a talk radio comment:
quote_txt: "Although the governor doubled the beach fees . . . all the money, as we found out, is all going to an out-of-state company. The state isn't even getting the money for that."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 14, 2014

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2014 in television ad:
quote_txt: U.S. Senate candidate Jack Kingston voted for the "Cash for Clunkers" program.

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2014 in comments on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Children are crossing the border because President Barack Obama said "if you come, you’re going to be able to stay, because we’re not going to enforce the law."

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2014 in comments on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: "This president has offered fewer executive actions than almost any other president preceding his presidency in recent history."

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: "I created the school choice program."

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2014 in an interview on WPRI's "Newsmakers.":
quote_txt: On the last night of the General Assembly, "by 11 o'clock 95 to 98 percent of the business was done. So we really didn't have that late-night session. We were just holding on one bill."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 13, 2014

description_txt: stated on June 23, 2014 in a Twitter post:
quote_txt: Another great endorsement! Barrow Journal explains the difference between me and Jody Hice.

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2014 in a press conference:
quote_txt: The U.S. Supreme Court is "five guys who start determining what contraceptions are legal."

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2014 in an economic issues statement:
quote_txt: The 2011 Rebuild America Jobs Act "would have cost the average American family $1,000 a year while making no significant impact to fix our infrastructure and roads."

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2014 in an economic issues statement:
quote_txt: "I co-sponsored the Rebuild America Jobs Act" for transportation and infrastructure.

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2014 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "Without the financial resources provided by hunters to protect habitat and stop poachers, there would be no infrastructure for wildlife management."

description_txt: stated on June 23, 2014 in a speech.:
quote_txt: "There are more than 46 million Americans living in poverty today -- the largest number in 54 years."

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2014 in radio and television ad:
quote_txt: Says Congressman Jack Kingston voted to "raise his pay seven times."

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2014 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: Says Charlie Crist "raised taxes on the middle class" by $2.2 billion.
